sentences.sContent: As a scientist, his influence was immense.
sentences.sCn: 身为一名科学家，他的影响力极大。

sentences.sContent: Marx was strongly influenced by the historian Niebuhr.
sentences.sCn: 马克思深受历史学家尼布尔的影响。

sentences.sContent: ...and allow what is there freely to attract and influence the eye to walk the rounds of the bookshops...
...which not only serves as crucial bridge to build trust and connection between two generations but also exerts a profound and subtle influence toward to children’s personal growth...
...others insist that the internet has a bad influence on interpersonal communication...
...it will impact and influence people’s family affection and friendship...
...Under her influence we became a blended family and a good relationship developed between the two families...
...Books influence the depth and breadth of life...
...you could influence the kinds of adults that those children would become...

synos.tran: 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事

phrases.pCn: n. 影响因素；电话干扰系数
不利影响；消极作用；负影响
n. 不正当影响；[律]不正当压力
外部影响；外来因素；外界影响

remMethod.val: in(进入) ＋ flu(流感) ＋ ence → 患上流感容易影响别人 → 影响

trans.tranOther: the power to affect the way someone or something develops, behaves, or thinks, without using direct force or orders
to affect the way someone or something develops, behaves, thinks etc without directly forcing or ordering them
